Author: PTYX#6840
Content: The internet says ```LGPL does not prevent commercial use in any way, see e.g.Â answers.google.com/answers/threadview/id/439136.htmlÂ Only a few open-source licenses limit by use case, and none of them are considered "free" by organisations like FSF. If you want to use a free license, the kind of split you want to achieve is usually done by having a strong free copyleft license, which does not prevent commercial use, but is off-putting to commercial users. Then your alternative could be worth purchasing for them, to avoid need to open-source their own code```

Author: PTYX#6840

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
jeeeezus.   what's important is not being a dick.  but if ppl are going to be dicks, i can betya i can be one of the top 5 biggest dicks in this discord.   but being a dick doesn't work.

here's why:
1.  I create some code like a front end to marketmaker.
2. i put an MIT derived license on it, calling it the _dont-be-a-dick_ license.
3. in the license, i put names of the dicks that cannot use this software in any capacity, open source, proprietary, network program, software as a service.
4. some equally dickish group picks up on the dont-be-a-dick license, does a little digging then finds out where these dicks work or their businesses.

you can't work with open source and be a dick. the code is more powerful than the dick.  the only dicks allowed are sociopath ceos of multinationals.  but these dicks do evil things, much more evil that what has happened in this channel.

Please sort it out and audit your licenses and abide by them if acting in a commercial capacity.  copyright  (& more importantly the infringements) can be bought by bigger fish in the litigation game and it all shits on the work of the ecosystem.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
I don't know about licenses etc, but after reading chat what I get is:
- MIT allows using the software/code with mention of it's source and authors with credit.
- Magnum intends to add the credit where it used the code from.
- Magnum is not open source?
- Better open source the code and then add the rewards library maybe?
- Until then maybe just hold on to that feature inaccessible until open sourced?

Just random thoughts just in case if there is really a respect for each others between @PTYX @hyperDEX and @lukechilds 

**Even if it sounds total unfair, it could possibly be done just for the good sake of friendship since you guys have been longer here enough working with each other.**
